channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Least 11 People Killed After Car Plows Into Vancouver Filipino Festival
item.description: Dozens of people were also reported injured after a car drove into a Filipino community festival in British Columbia, the police said.

item.title: D.E.A. Says More Than 100 Undocumented Immigrants Were Detained in a Colorado Raid

item.title: Protests Against Israeli Official Heat Up Outside Synagogue in Brooklyn

item.title: Asian wealth can bridge the SDG financing gap—but philanthropy needs a strategy shift
item.description: Asia-Pacific will need an additional $1.5 trillion annually to meet its SDG targets. Where can it find that money? From those who hold its wealth.

item.title: U.S. Military Says Its Air Campaign Has Hit More Than 800 Targets in Yemen
item.description: President Trump ordered a start to the strikes against the Houthis on March 15. Congressional officials say the campaign has cost well over $1 billion...

item.title: Dick Barnett, Champion Knick With a Singular Jump Shot, Dies at 88
item.description: A guard, he played on New York’s two (and only) title-winning teams, in the 1970s. He was remembered for his scoring and his “fall back, baby” shootin...

item.title: Don’t expect SEC enforcement to just disappear under new chairman Paul Atkins, warn 3 former general counsels
item.description: Accounting and disclosure fraud and insider trading are likely to be key enforcement priorities at the SEC.

item.title: Valentin-Yves Mudimbe, 83, Dies; African Scholar Challenged the West
item.description: He deconstructed what he called “the colonial library”: the accounts of Africa by Europeans whose aim, he said, was to further colonialism.

item.title: At Least 11 People Killed After Car Plows Into Vancouver Filipino Festival
item.description: Dozens of people were also reported injured after a car drove into a Filipino community festival in British Columbia, the police said.

item.title: CEOs are in distress and consumers fear job losses amid ‘stagflation shock,’ economist warns
item.description: New research from Apollo Global Management outlines the tariff impact on U.S. businesses and consumers. Signs are pointing toward recession by summer.

item.title: ‘I’m not looking’ — Americans close to retirement are afraid to check their account balances
item.description: President Trump has urged people to “be cool” in assessing the impact of tariffs on their investments. Asked about his own savings earlier this month,...
